author: SteveL-MSFT
body:
If a parameter of an error message contains VT escape sequence, it gets rendered when it should be escaped.

It's a separate issue whether we should allow for such a file to be created.

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
set-content -Path "world`e`[32mhello.txt" -Value "bye"                                                                                                                                                                

```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```none
set-content : An object at the specified path 'world`e`[32mhello.txt' does not exist, or has been filtered by the -Include or -Exclude parameter.
At line:1 char:1
+ set-content -Path "world`e`[32mhello.txt" -Value "bye"
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (System.String[]:String[]) [Set-Content], Exception
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : ItemNotFound,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.SetContentCommand
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
# the text starting at hello.txt is green which is what the escape sequence does
set-content : An object at the specified path worldhello.txt does not exist, or has been filtered by the -Include or -Exclude parameter.
At line:1 char:1
+ set-content -Path "world`e`[32mhello.txt" -Value "bye"
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (System.String[]:String[]) [Set-Content], Exception
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : ItemNotFound,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.SetContentCommand
```

title: Error message is rendering escape sequence rather than escaping it
